definition: to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil

sentences.english: Firecrackers boomed out from the front of a shop echoing loudly.
sentences.chinese: 前面的小店里传来的隆隆的爆竹声。

sentences.english: Safety glasses should be worn when setting off fireworks and sparklers.
sentences.chinese: 应戴安全眼镜时燃放烟花爆竹和烟花。

sentences.english: For others it is merely a way to share in a centuries-old tradition.
sentences.chinese: 对另外一些人而言，爆竹纯粹是分享一种悠久的传统。

sentences.english: It is dangerous to shoot off fireworks.
A basic fireworks safety rule is to remain standing when using sparklers.
sentences.chinese: 烟花爆竹安全的一个基本规则是站立时，使用烟火。

sentences.english: It is forbidden to bring fireworks on board trains during Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 春运期间，禁止挟带烟花爆竹上车。

sentences.english: Factories making fire-crackers and fireworks or gunpowder.
sentences.chinese: 三爆竹烟火工厂及火药类制造工作场所。

sentences.english: Setting off fireworks has its advantages and disadvantages, so we should set off fire-works limitedly.
sentences.chinese: 燃放烟花爆竹有利有弊，所以我们应该有所限制。

sentences.english: In my opinion, setting fireworks should be limited to certain areas and time.
sentences.chinese: 在我看来，放烟花爆竹应仅限于某些地区和时间。

sentences.english: Do you think it's good to forbid firecrackers and fireworks?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得禁止放烟花爆竹是好事吗？

sentences.english: Firecrackers burst around celebrants at the Vegetarian Festival in Phuket, Thailand.
sentences.chinese: 泰国普吉岛的素食节上，爆竹在人们的身边爆炸。

sentences.english: When there is a firecracker voice ringing out, I slightly and at hand block up her ear.
sentences.chinese: 当有爆竹声响起时，我就轻轻地用手堵住她的耳朵。

sentences.english: " The firecracker, red, can break ground if brocade, called "ManTangGong".
sentences.chinese: 爆竹声后，碎红满地，灿若云锦，称为“满堂红”。

sentences.english: Please join us to light off firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 让我们一起燃放爆竹除旧岁。

sentences.english: I played firecracker but I hurt my finger with the fire.
sentences.chinese: 在我玩爆竹的时候，伤着了我的手指。

sentences.english: The Spring Festival in the morning, open the door plug and firecrackers, called the "first opened the firecracker went off."
sentences.chinese: 春节早晨，开门大吉，先放爆竹，叫做“开门炮仗”。

definition: firecrackers set off at the stroke of midnight on New Year's Day (a Chinese tradition)
sky lantern (miniature hot-air balloon used during festivals)
Lantern Festival/night of the 15th of the first lunar month/see also 元夜[yuan2 ye4]/sticky rice dumplings
